intro: Sherbournia amaralioides, commonly known as the purpleleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and succulent leaves. The plant is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, hairy stems, and vibrant purple to reddish leaves that provide visual interest. Its small, clustered flowers are typically greenish-white or pale yellow, and it produces dry, capsule-like fruits. Sherbournia amaralioides is adapted to arid environments and is often found in sandy or gravelly soils.
